security_audit.summary: This skill is pure documentation with test command examples. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access beyond its own file. Contains only markdown documentation for running tests.

content.user_title: Run project tests with Bun or pytest
content.value_statement: Writing tests is essential but running them manually wastes time. This skill provides ready-to-use commands for executing test suites with Bun for JavaScript or pytest for Python projects.
actual_capabilities: Run all tests in a TypeScript or JavaScript project with Bun
Run all tests in a Python project with pytest
Execute specific test files by path
Run tests matching a pattern or filter
limitations: Commands must be customized for each project
Requires Bun installed for JavaScript tests
Requires uv and pytest installed for Python tests
Does not write or modify test files

best_practices: Customize the SKILL.md file with your project-specific test commands
Run tests after every code change to catch issues early
Use coverage reports to identify untested code paths
Run specific test files during development for faster feedback
anti_patterns: Running tests without checking the exit code
Ignoring test failures and continuing development
Running the entire test suite when a single module was modified
Not using coverage reports to monitor test quality

faq.question: Which test frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Bun test for JavaScript/TypeScript and pytest for Python. Add your own commands for other frameworks.

faq.question: What exit codes do tests return?
faq.answer: Exit code 0 means all tests passed. Exit code 1 means one or more tests failed.

faq.question: Can I use this with other test runners?
faq.answer: Yes. Edit the SKILL.md file to add commands for Jest, Vitest, unittest, or any other framework.

faq.question: Is my data safe when running tests?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only executes tests. It does not read, transmit, or store any data outside the project directory.

faq.question: Tests are failing. How do I debug?
faq.answer: Run tests with verbose mode (-v) to see detailed output. Check the specific test file and error messages.

faq.question: How is this different from other test skills?
faq.answer: This skill is project-specific and customizable. It contains the exact commands your project needs.
